intro: Tradescantia striata, commonly known as the wandering jew, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the spiderwort family (Commelinaceae) and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage that ranges from deep red to purple and green. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is a low-maintenance plant that thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Tradescantia striata is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to spread quickly through rhizomes.
